column4: hi guys i have some big problems here, my cpu is constantly at 97 % and i dont know whats causing it
even when i log out its loading
ssh in, type top and hit enter, see what's running w/ high cpu
er... forget ssh in, just start terminal, lol :X
too used to working w/ server remotely :X

xorg...  only thing that rings a bell from my experience when when I messed up and installed xwin server or something when I was trying to get compiz fusion working w/ an outdated tutorial a while back.... only resolution to that for me was to uninstall the xserver thing it recommended.
can i kill the process or is it critical?
do not kill xorg, or else you'll lose your xwindows
it worked fine before untill now
something you've installed must've been mis-configured or mis-configured xorg some how... were you trying to install anything just before this happened?
is it a way to see the tree of the process to see what is causing it?
do you have htop installed?  though, I don't know if xorg have any child processes... :X
no im installing it now, i see on the internet that many has the same problem
